intro: Sabatia obtusata, commonly known as bluntleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and have a bluish-green hue with a slightly rough texture. Sabatia obtusata thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and dunes.
